title: Payment Data Ingestion Platform
description: Built real-time payment data ingestion pipelines processing millions of transactions monthly, powering analytics, risk dashboards, and merchant insights.
fullDescription: A high-volume data ingestion platform that processes payment transaction data from global PSPs in near real-time. The system powers analytics dashboards, risk scoring, and actionable merchant insights.
problem: Merchants lacked visibility into transaction performance across PSPs. Data was fragmented and delayed, preventing timely decision-making on approval optimization.
constraints: Must handle millions of transactions monthly with low latency. Required integration with diverse PSP data formats and guarantee data consistency for financial reporting.
approach: Built event-driven ingestion pipelines using AWS Lambda, Kafka, and SQS. Implemented data lake architecture with Athena for ad-hoc queries and Redshift for structured analytics.
tradeoffs: Chose eventual consistency for analytics to prioritize ingestion throughput. Accepted higher storage costs for raw data retention supporting compliance requirements.
execution: Iterative development as part of Pagos platform. Led architecture decisions, code reviews, and production support for reliability.
outcomes: Enabled near real-time reporting and operational decision-making for international merchants. Powered risk dashboards and merchant-facing insights.
whatIdImprove: Would have invested in self-service data exploration tools for merchants earlier.
